title: Compilation Errors with SWIG on newer GCC/Ubuntu Versions

content.raw:
@caguero discovered that there are some issues building ign-math4 with SWIG enabled on newer Ubuntu/GCC versions.

It looks to affect Zesty as well as Bionic (GCC Version 7.3.0), but only when compiling with SWIG enabled.

```
[ 62%] Building CXX object src/CMakeFiles/math.dir/rubyRUBY_wrap.cxx.o
cd /home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/build/src && /usr/bin/c++   -Dmath_EXPORTS -I/home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/include -I/home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/build/include -I/usr/include/ruby-2.3.0 -I/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/ruby-2.3.0  -O2 -g -DNDEBUG  -Wall -Wextra -Wno-long-long -Wno-unused-value -Wfloat-equal -Wshadow -Winit-self -Wswitch-default -Wmissing-include-dirs -pedantic -UNDEBUG -fPIC   -msse -msse2 -mfpmath=sse -msse3 -mssse3 -msse4.1 -msse4.2 -std=c++14 -w -o CMakeFiles/math.dir/rubyRUBY_wrap.cxx.o -c /home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/build/src/rubyRUBY_wrap.cxx
In file included from /home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/build/src/rubyRUBY_wrap.cxx:1911:0:
/home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/include/ignition/math/Vector2.hh: In member function ‘bool ignition::math::v4::Vector2<T>::IsFinite() const’:
/home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/include/ignition/math/Vector2.hh:370:16: error: ‘finite’ is not a member of ‘std’
         return std::isfinite(static_cast<double>(this->data[0])) &&
                ^~~
/home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/include/ignition/math/Vector2.hh:370:16: note: suggested alternative:
In file included from /usr/include/features.h:364:0,
                 from /usr/include/string.h:25,
                 from /home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/build/src/rubyRUBY_wrap.cxx:464:
/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/bits/mathcalls.h:208:1: note:   ‘finite’
 __MATHDECL_1 (int,finite,, (_Mdouble_ __value)) __attribute__ ((__const__));
```
content.html:
@caguero discovered that there are some issues building ign-math4 with SWIG enabled on newer Ubuntu/GCC versions.

It looks to affect Zesty as well as Bionic (GCC Version 7.3.0), but only when compiling with SWIG enabled.

[ 62%] Building CXX object src/CMakeFiles/math.dir/rubyRUBY_wrap.cxx.o
cd /home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/build/src && /usr/bin/c++   -Dmath_EXPORTS -I/home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/include -I/home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/build/include -I/usr/include/ruby-2.3.0 -I/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/ruby-2.3.0  -O2 -g -DNDEBUG  -Wall -Wextra -Wno-long-long -Wno-unused-value -Wfloat-equal -Wshadow -Winit-self -Wswitch-default -Wmissing-include-dirs -pedantic -UNDEBUG -fPIC   -msse -msse2 -mfpmath=sse -msse3 -mssse3 -msse4.1 -msse4.2 -std=c++14 -w -o CMakeFiles/math.dir/rubyRUBY_wrap.cxx.o -c /home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/build/src/rubyRUBY_wrap.cxx
In file included from /home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/build/src/rubyRUBY_wrap.cxx:1911:0:
/home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/include/ignition/math/Vector2.hh: In member function ‘bool ignition::math::v4::Vector2<T>::IsFinite() const’:
/home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/include/ignition/math/Vector2.hh:370:16: error: ‘finite’ is not a member of ‘std’
         return std::isfinite(static_cast<double>(this->data[0])) &&
                ^~~
/home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/include/ignition/math/Vector2.hh:370:16: note: suggested alternative:
In file included from /usr/include/features.h:364:0,
                 from /usr/include/string.h:25,
                 from /home/caguero/workspace/ign-math/build/src/rubyRUBY_wrap.cxx:464:
/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/bits/mathcalls.h:208:1: note:   ‘finite’
 __MATHDECL_1 (int,finite,, (_Mdouble_ __value)) __attribute__ ((__const__));
